Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and label different types of habitats such as a playground, garden, forest, pond, or stream.
The student can illustrate various kinds of plants found in each habitat, including trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants, with most being accurately represented.
The student can depict different animals or insects in each habitat like lizards, squirrels, ants, or fish, with generally correct labeling and positioning.
The student can show comparisons by drawing the diversity of living things found in different habitats, effectively highlighting how they are similar or different in most cases.
The student can include observed patterns in the natural world to a good extent, showing variety and placement of plants and animals, although some patterns might be incomplete.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally miss labeling certain plants or animals, resulting in incomplete representations.

The student may inconsistently capture the full diversity within a given habitat or misunderstand some specific species' typical environments *(e.g., placing a tropical bird in a forest drawing without context)*.
Some comparisons across habitats might lack depth, with a few examples missing or species inaccurately depicted *(e.g., a fish on land without context)*.
